The claim is based on a statement made b: Rick Perry, who frequently talks about the Texas economy and job gains since he took office almost 10 years ago.
The claim was fact: checked by the Truth-O-Meter, which rated it as True in an article published on September 23.
The Perry campaign referred to U: S. Bureau of Labor Statistics data on state employment to support the claim of adding more than 850,000 new jobs between January 2001 and June 2010.
The claim was challenged by the Democrat: s camp, pointing out that the job numbers had changed after the initial fact-check, making the claim inaccurate.
